content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Puzzle sympa... mais...

ORTHOGRAPHE

Ambigu, uë. En orthographe traditionnelle (non réformée), tréma sur le e au féminin : une attitude ambiguë.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to solve and will make a good addition to cod

You need to add a coma before "then" : "if the new string is empty, then" (both in Goal and in Output).

I think you should add a test with only one line since the contraints says 1 <= T <= 10

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good One

Hello,

It's a good clash as for me. I also think, it's could be great to add "reverse" and "codegolf" as options for game mode

Goal
* Please format "EMPTY" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Output
* Please format "EMPTY" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints
* Please change "[[S]]" to "length of [[S]]".

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar but different. Please revise the cases accordingly.

* Test 3 / Validator 3: One of the input strings end with a space character. That violates the last constraint. Please fix the case.

* Please rename the cases below Validator 3, as the numbering has gone wrong in those cases.

Stub generator
* Please change "T" to "S" for consistency with other sections.

Thanks.
I have made the necessary changes.

Hello,
I don't think I understood the meaning of your comment... This is not a puzzle and I don't see what the word "ambiguous" has to do with it?

Hello,
It's true that this comment is not addressed to the creator of the puzzle but to a web designer. In fact when I sent it, a table with checkboxes was present with an item where the word "ambigüe" appears. Hence my spelling remark... may be too purist. Of course my comment can be removed by a web manager. Sorry for this poorly positioned comment in this puzzle.
You've missed the part that "Each pair of test and validator should be similar".

Each pair can feature similar scenarios.

For example:
Test 1 and Validator 1 focus on short strings of lowercase characters only, and no string becomes empty after the removal of characters.

Test 2 and Validator 2 focus on short strings of uppercase characters only, and no string becomes empty after the removal of characters.

Test 3 and Validator 3 focus on short strings of mixed case characters, and no string becomes empty after the removal of characters.

Test 4 and Validator 4 focus on short strings of mixed case characters, and some strings become empty after the removal of characters.

Test 5 and Validator 5 cover every scenario with longer strings.

The differences between a test and a validator are:

(a) A player can see the tests during a clash, but they cannot see the validators. So, it's a bad idea to cover something in the validators only but not in the tests - that may become a nasty surprise to the player.

(b) A player’s code is assessed by running it against the validators, not the tests. So, it's a bad idea to cover something in the tests only but not in the validators - because such situations are excluded from the assessment when determining the final score.

Thanks for giving me such a brief description.
It helped a lot.

Looking better now! But some strings are too long and violate the second constraint in these cases:

bothcase empty (test)
mixed case , empty & no empty (test)
mixed case , empty & no empty (validator)

Please fix the constraint and/or the cases. Thanks.
